description: {"blocks":[{"key":"d5bc5","text":"This protocol offers detailed, step-by-step instructions for students and researchers to assemble nuclear genomes using long reads generated by Nanopore technology. Before assembling the genome, we will align the reads against a bacterial genome database to eliminate potential contamination. The assembled contigs will then be polished using Illumina short reads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"bd5qg","text":"Ferrari RR, Batista TM, Zhou QS, Hilário HO, Orr MC, Luo A, Zhu CD. The Whole Genome of Colletes collaris (Hymenoptera: Colletidae): An Important Step in Comparative Genomics of Cellophane Bees. Genome Biol Evol. 2023 May 5;15(5):evad062. doi: 10.1093/gbe/evad062. PMID: 37075227; PMCID: PMC10159585.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":88,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working
